result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

to Court from Crystal Taylor 9/21/17re: NA Meetings & Huber

GRANTED 9/25/17

Clerk: Kimberly
Case called: 2:03pm
INCLUDES 15CM1582, 15CM1692, 16CM769, 16CM2240, 16CM2346, 17CF835
State appears by ADA Davis Runde for ADA Raymond Pelrine in 5 SAR cases; Defendant appears in person, in custody, with Atty Pauline Toulouse
Date and time set for SAR in 15CM1582, 15CM1692, 16CM769, 16CM2240, 16CM2346 & plea in 17CF835

** SAR in 15CM1582, 15CM1692, 16CM769, 16CM2240, 16CM2346 **
Parties state recommendation for sentencing
COURT ORDERS: 15CM1582 Ct. 1 Resisting or Obstructing an Officer: Serve 9 months jail. 98 days credit granted.
COURT ORDERS: 15CM1692 Ct. 1 Possession of THC: Serve 6 months jail. 98 days credit granted. 
COURT ORDERS: 16CM769 Ct. 1 Contributing to Truancy: Serve 30 days jail. 98 days credit granted. 
COURT ORDERS: 16CM2240 Ct. 1 Retail Theft- intentionally take (<=$500): Serve 9 months jail. 98 days credit granted. Ct. 2 Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor: Serve 9 months jail. 98 days credit granted. Ct. 3 Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor: Serve 9 months jail. 98 days credit granted. Ct. 4 Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor: Serve 9 months jail. 98 days credit granted. 
COURT ORDERS: 16CM2346 Ct. 1 Resisting/Failing to Stop:  Serve 6 months jail. 98 days credit granted.
COURT ORDERS: All sentences to run concurrent to each other, jail sentences to continuing running foward. Jail may be with huber release for work, work search, treatment, child care, or school if meets jail criteria. Any outstanding court costs- $1408.00 in CC, $1000.00 for DNA surcharge, and $536.00 in victim witness surcharge are converted into civil judgments. 

** PLEA in 17CF835 **
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
State moves to:
Ct. 2 Possession on THC (2nd+ offense)- repeater >> D&RI
COURT grants above
PLEA:
Ct. 1 Possession of Narcotic Drugs- repeater >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: w/hold sentencing. 3 years probabtion, consecutive to jail sentences. CONDITIONS: Complete any assessment, treatment or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Maintain absolute sobriety from illegal drugs and alcohol. Complete AODA assessment with follow through. Pay CC. Pay DNA surcharge and provide sample. If revoked, zero days credit.

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & defendant guilty;
COURT ORDERS: SWH for 2 1/2 years probation; CONDITIONS: IMPOSE 120 days MCJ and STAY 60 days for rule violations; w/huber for work/treatment/childcare/AA/NA; Counseling/Assessments as deemed appropriate by agent; D.B. must attend school with no unexcused absences or tardies; LEAP parenting class; Absolute Sobriety; AODA and follow up; Letter of Apology to Officers; 45 hours CS; Maintain FTW/school or combination of the two and if not so fully engaged, complete 10 job applications per week and 5 hours CS per week; CC; DNA sample and surcharge;

COURT notes deft has 18 days credit to be applied towards conditional jail; 0 days credit if revoked;
COURT notes restitution is not requested;

Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Absolute sobriety from illegal drugs and alcohol.    No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.  Children to attend school as required; must have doctor excuses.
